pr_title: Cosmos CFP: fix for handling partition splits or partition not found

timeline.message:
Bug fix when handling partition splits or partition not found.
  The cause of the bug is a typo in the call to log the current partition information such as the partition ID.
Bug fix when syncronizing lease updates across different threads.
Add test case for handling partition splits.
disable the split test in order to rule it out as causing the CI failure. Splits are not properly handled when tests are run against the public emulator.
change new test group and default timings for CFP tests

timeline.bodyText:
when a class is annotated with jackson annotation, jackson uses reflection for serialization/deserialization to json.
reflection is expensive and that being said, If there are pre existing classes in the code which needs to be serialized/deserialized to json we should ideally use a jackson serializer rather than annotating the class with jackson annotation.
(not necessarily in the scope of this PR, but something to be addressed outside of this PR).
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: n this case the "_etag" field was not passed through the serialization and that resulted in "IF MATCH" condition to fail when updating the lease document.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
The ask is to add something similar to this:
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/implementation/routing/PartitionKeyInternal.java#L35-L36
The internal types should not rely on reflection for serialization/deserialization.
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Fixed. We only need a serializer here, the de-serialization is done at the Document/CosmosItemProperties level and that instance it is later used to create a Lease instance.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
If you have a serializer you need a deserializer too.
Document/CosmosItemProperties should call to the custom deserializer for deserialization. no?
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText: partition split normally takes 10-20 min to complete. how are we ensuring that the test sees partition split completing within its life time?
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: There's a check later to ensure that we see at least 2 partitions. In regular case it takes couple minutes (not 10 minutes) to detect the split.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: don't catch InterruptedException if that's thrown, we can fail the test.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: We need to in this case, in order to avoid compilation errors...
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: why can't we add exception to the test method signature?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: replied on a similar comment below...
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: don't catch InterruptedException if that's thrown, we can fail the test.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: here and elsewhere please. we don't need to catch this, let it get thrown
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: The try/catch is needed to avoid compilation errors such as: "Error:(440, 29) java: unreported exception java.lang.InterruptedException; must be caught or declared to be thrown"
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
makes sense here.
so please use this instead to translate checked to unchecked exception.
https://projectreactor.io/docs/core/release/api/reactor/core/Exceptions.html#propagate-java.lang.Throwable-
if InterruptedException we should error out.
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
Good suggestion, but it goes way beyond what we need to address at this time which is to release a fix for the CFP ASAP.
Feel free to open an issue and assign it to me to refactor these tests and remove the handling of the exception.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
@milismsft I have already signed off on v3, and I agree with you on v3 as this is hotfix for v3 it should go out as soon as possible.
IMO, on v4 we should do the right thing (this is not in prod yet) rather than introducing technical debt.
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: V4 latest release is currently used by couple customers a preview.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: I'll deal with the debt later; the changes you're requesting go beyond what this PR/work item should address. IMHO et's keep things simple enough in case we need to review this later and use a different PR to address  other things.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: Implement its own Json serializer for the Lease class.

timeline.bodyText: Please add unit test scoped to serialization.

replies.bodyText: removed
replies.author: milismsft

replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText:
LeaseToken, ContinuationToken, Owner are Camel case, but timestamp, id, etag are not is that expected?
also for Owner, timestamp, ContinuationToken, LeaseToken we probably should define constants.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
The current naming convention follows .Net and the content of a lease document as written from that code. The idea behind this design is that you can have CFP instances resuming work from both platforms, Java and .NET.
The ServiceItemLease is internal only (not exposed to the user); for the easy of debugging keeping the same names for members and the content of the lease document as written in Cosmos is actually beneficial.
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: Clean-up and add unit test for lease serialization.

timeline.bodyText:
thank you for the test. as a code style rule we don't add "test" as prefix.
Please drop the "test" prefix to be consistent with other tests.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.bodyText: please drop the try/catch block here. if there is a failure the failure should get thrown and the exception needs to be added to the test method signature.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: update test signature and remove try/catch

timeline.bodyText:
we should add a deserializer as well. Document/CosmosItemProperties can use the custom deserializer.
You can take a look at PartitionKeyInternal.java as example.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Won't fix.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
Won't fix.

why?
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: already explained "why"; you're asking to add dead code because there's no direct Json deserialization that is needed for ServiceItemLease at this time. The "deserialization" is done via fromDocument() method call.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText: the explanation on fromDocument() makes sense. so that acts as the deserializer, that's what needed. thanks.
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.bodyText:
"simple" test group is only invoked as integration test in the presence of a cosmosdb endpoint.
as this is unit test, not integration test, the group needs to be "unit".  (groups = { "unit" })
also the unit tests should go in a separate class, e.g.,  please move the test to  the new class ServiceItemLeaseTest.java
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Won't fix.
replies.author: milismsft

replies.bodyText:
Won't fix.

why?
replies.author: moderakh

timeline.message: test refactoring; each test will use it's own instance of the received document map.

Refactoring to create test related resources within each test.
Remove try/catch on InterruptedExceptions calls.

timeline.bodyText:
I suspect you have client leak in your test class. this might cause CI test issues later.
the afterClass is annotated as part of emulator test group. But your partition split test is in a different test group, i.e., simple test group. Due to that the afterClass may not get invoked for the partition split test.
Our test pattern is to not mix different test groups in the same class for simplicity.
Different test group go to different test classes, otherwise you need to be very cautious in the cleaning logic.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: @kushagraThapar FYI
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Fixed
replies.author: milismsft

timeline.message: Add missing group for before and after related test methods
